document.docAuthor: Cock, Matthew J. W. & Robbins, Robert K.
document.masterDocTitle: Annotated checklist and biogeographic composition of the Lycaenidae (Lepidoptera) of Trinidad, West Indies

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Annotated checklist and biogeographic composition of the Lycaenidae (Lepidoptera) of Trinidad, West Indies

subSubSection.paragraph:
Tmolus comana (Hewitson)
: Kaye (1940 , no. 217b), Barcant (1970 , no. 299) [synonym]

New island record collected by J.O. Boos (Cat’s Hill,
Dec 1979
, in MJWC )
; also collected by F.C. Urich.

New island record collected by F.C. Urich , M.J.W. Cock ( ♂ , Las Lomas,
Jan 1982
; ♂ , Parrylands,
Nov 1981
) and J. and F. Preston
.
New island record collected by S. Alston-Smith ( ♂ , Rio Claro – Guayaguayare Road, Oct 1995 ).

New island record collected by S. Alston-Smith ( ♀ , Sangre Grande , Sep 1980 ) and M.J.W. Cock ( ♀ , Inniss Field, Oct 1994 ). No males have been found as yet, for which reason this identification is tentative.

Rekoa meton (Cramer)
: Kaye (1904 , no. 167), Kaye (1921 , no. 246), Barcant (1970 , no. 357), Robbins (1991) , D’Abrera (1995 , p. 1249), Warren et al. (2015)

Rekoa palegon (Cramer)
: Kaye (1940 , no. 246a), Barcant (1970 , no. 358), Robbins (1991) , D’Abrera (1995 , p. 1249), Beccaloni et al. (2008) , Geerah and Rutherford (2015) , Warren et al. (2015)

Thecla zebina (Hewitson)
: Kaye (1940 , no. 247c) [misidentification], Barcant (1970 , no. 370) [misidentification, part]

Rekoa marius (Lucas)
: Robbins (1991) , Beccaloni et al. (2008) , Warren et al. (2015)

Rekoa zebina
is a Central American species that resembles
R. marius
and
R. stagira (Hewitson) ( Robbins 1991 )
. Kaye’s (1940) original report was based on two specimens collected by F.W. Jackson (St Joseph 5.iv.1922 ; Balata Hill 28.iii.1922 ) but these have not been located in BMNH (main sequence) or OMNH. The series in Barcant’s collection appears to comprise seven
R. marius
and two
R. stagira
, but the specimen illustrated ( Barcant 1970 , plate 28.24) is not in his collection now.

Tmolus stagira Hewitson
: Kaye (1904 , no. 145, citing Crowfoot (1893))

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Rekoa stagira (Hewitson)
: Robbins (1991) ,
D’Abrera (1995 , p. 1250
), Sookdeo (2013) , Warren et al. (2015)

subSubSection.paragraph:
S. voltinia
is a synonym of
Kolana ergina (Hewitson) ( Robbins 2004 )
, and we assume that represents Kaye’s (1921) use of the name. In his collection, Barcant curated what appear to be four
Rekoa stagira
and five
R. marius
as
Siderus voltinia
. The specimen illustrated ( Barcant 1970 , plate 28.24) is a male
R. stagira
in his collection.
Not previously recorded from Trinidad , but included on the basis of a specimen from Matura in USNM and more recent captures on Chacachacare Island by S. Alston-Smith.

Arawacus linus (Fabricius)
: Kaye (1904 , no. 163), Guppy (1904) , Kaye (1921 , no. 247), Barcant (1970 , no. 353), Lewis (1974 , plate 66.9) [synonym]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Arawacus aetolus (Sulzer)
:
D’Abrera (1995 , p. 1134
–35), Geerah and Rutherford (2015)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Arawacus aetolus aetolus (Sulzer)
: Robbins and Aiello (1982)

Thecla spurius (C. Felder and R. Felder)
: Longstaff (1912) [synonym]

Rekoa dolylas (Cramer)
: Kaye (1914) , Kaye (1940 , no. 246b), Barcant (1970 , no. 359)

Tigrinota spurius (C. Felder and R. Felder)
: Johnson (1993b) [synonym]

Polyniphes dumenilii (Godart)
: Kaye (1904 , no. 140), Longstaff (1912) , Kaye (1921 , no. 254), Barcant (1970 , no. 354, incorrectly attributed to Kaye’s authorship, but Kaye (1904) actually described the genus
Polyniphes
), Lewis (1974 , plate 67.24)

Tmolus ergina (Hewitson)
: Kaye (1904 , no. 147, citing Crowfoot (1893))

Calycopis ergina (Hew.)
: Kaye (1921 , no. 225) Barcant (1970 , no. 312) [based on Crowfoot (1893) ]

In his collection, Barcant had no specimens as
C. ergina
, whereas he curated 4– 5 specimens of
K. ergina
as
C. socia
.
